summary:
Because of my mathematics background and 7 years experience with backend development, I am good at solving complex challenges. Taking on algorithmic or mathematical challenges by means of programming, is my passion. I often work alone on a problem, and I am good at coordinating with management what exactly needs to be done. In addition I like explaining mathematical problems to management, so it becomes clear where the problems are and what solutions are possible and desirable.

Technologies: Java, C#, Python, C++, Javascript, React Native, BASIC,  Java Spring (Boot), Hibernate, AOP, AWS, Data Analysis, SQL, Docker, SOAP, REST-API, Linear Algebra, 3D-Geometry, A-Star, Douglas-Peucker, Bezier Curves, Direct-X

Personal Details:
• 7 years experience as a backend developer
• programming language agnostic
• very analytical
• have been programming since the age of 7
• loves brain-twisters in my work
• have been working since 2015 as a software developer, before that I was alternately a mathematical tutor and software developer

- choose shape/3d-model
- choose symmetry (like cube, dodecahedron, icosahedron and dihedral)
- move or rotate the shape
- apply cutting planes
- change colors of the stickers
- apply pictures on the stickers
- bandage cubies
This gives the player an almost limitless number of possibilities.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Wouter', 'last_name': 'Meesen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Mathematical/Algorithmic Software Developer'}]}, {'title': '3D Race track Editor + Game in C#', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'I wrote a program that allows the user to create a 3D race track. In addition, they can see which susidies might be relevant for them. To apply for a subsidy the citizen can fill in a form on the smartphone, or can answer questions asked by a chatbot. 
I also translated a SSI-Library (Self Sovereign Identity) from javascript to python, and set up a chatbot with Rasa. This chatbot also works with python.', 'title': 'Python/React Native Developer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 77216950, 'name': 'T-Hive', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHuPkY1-oEyYA/company-logo_400_400/0/1618953553124?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=9eCrR_cOqrB2IhqiaJTvzoMGUFSydRh97RhAC8HuxTQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/tico-hive/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Ede, Gelderland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'T-Hive', 'description': '• Java • Eclipse • Robotics • Bezier Curves • NURBS • 2D Geometry

At T-Hive, a subsidiary of Toyota, I worked on software that lets forklifts drive autonomously in a warehouse. I worked on the system that gives orders to the forklifts where to pickup goods, and where to put them, and designed an algorithm that prevents forklifts from colliding with each other. To this end, I divided the warehouse in small squares, and calculated which squares the forklifts crossed during their travels. This way it was fast and easy to see which trucks occupied the same squares and collided with each other. In addition I designed an algorithm that calculates an approximation of a bezier curve with circular arcs.', 'title': 'Java Software Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}]}, {'company': {'id': 17354, 'name': 'Triodos Bank', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQG6a8yXedCLbQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1613992076146?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=LpdAnquyIk_B8OIn_hMOQV_KsoP7b_myPMRGB1JKX_o', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/triodos-bank/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Zeist, Utrecht, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Triodos Bank', 'description': '• Java • SQL • InteliJ IDEA

At the Triodos Bank I worked on a payment system called Triton. This is an extensive program for which I performed maintenance tasks by writing java code. I also wrote SQL queries.', 'title': 'Java Backend Developer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 10823413, 'name': 'Atum 3D', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEiZhaoWnxWvQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1580482142687?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=BjzTRsF04O1w0C0QMrHFb0Rze24P9yAFcjLKT1lXiCg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/atum3d/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Gouda, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'atum3D', 'description': '• C# • MS Visual Studio • 3D Geometry

At Atum 3D I worked on making surfaces of 3D printed objects smoother. Since the printed objects consist of small cubes (0.1 mm wide), the diagonal lines are little ‘stairs’. To make these smooth, the cubes were illuminated longer by the lightsource to turn the cubes into small spheres and have them blend into each other. Together with an anti-alias algorithm it was calculated how long each cube should be illuminated. By calculating for what percentage the volume of a cube lies inside the 3D object, it is possible to determine how many extra seconds the cube should be illuminated. Together with a thicker edge that made extra cube growth possible, objects could get a smoother surface.', 'title': 'C# Backend Programmer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 4988, 'name': 'SLTN Inter Access', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQH2mKPFL8XJNw/company-logo_400_400/0/1622464884108?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=n2yu1TTLGONEgaRcH1Y8VGHuR2XYnnKwK5WUzuhcOiU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/sltn-futureproofit/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hilversum', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'SLTN', 'description': '• Python • Jupyter Notebook • sklearn • numpy • pandas

At SLTN I specialised in Data Science. I have experience with python and different regression and classification techniques. In addition I gained experience in using the development environment Jupyter Notebook. In this environment I used python packages like numpy, pandas, sklearn and matplotlib.', 'title': 'Data Scientist', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 772056, 'name': 'Panteia', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFVRFfN7eU3gw/company-logo_400_400/0/1649939379343?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=H2MjvcGxxTqwp2ZeQnQ-ttaAtidQ2uJxxRNsyyZsD1U', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/panteia/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Zoetermeer', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Panteia', 'description': '• Python • REST-API • Docker • SOAP • A Star

For research agency Panteia I worked on a python application that calculated the shortest route over rivers and canals in Europe for inland shipping. This meant open and closing times of bridges and locks had to be taken into account, together with temporarily closed rivers and canals. For this project I wrote a REST-API that could be accessed via the web. I also used Docker to make the application run on any server.', 'title': 'Python Backend Developer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 6374033, 'name': 'Carapax IT', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQF_855hijSD7A/company-logo_400_400/0/1607932851821?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=eRWqtYYAE8LFZJYfz8i6h-pGLipH2PSS4joIGcGa5ss', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/carapaxit/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Gouda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Carapax IT - Impact maak je samen', 'description': '• C# • MS Visual Studio • 2D Geometry • Douglas-Peucker • Bezier Curves

At Carapax IT I was working as a C# programmer for a company called Made Smart Group. I was responsible for interpreting and turn AIS data (data of ships like position, speed, travel direction, destination etc.) into useful information. Some interesting challenges were:

• Heat map to visualize traffic density all around the globe
• Detect if a ship has been in a port
• Placing labels on the world map
• Clean up the route network of travel routes, to determine optimal routes between 2 ports', 'title': 'Data Analyst and C# Developer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1212356, 'name': 'Xelion', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHi_tuElUCZDw/company-logo_400_400/0/1632992764453?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=fthlbOHUCZD4DU9WdvQQAfruE6T70bdY6YZBGMliry8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/xelion_2/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Delft', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Xelion', 'description': '• Java • Eclipse • SOAP

I worked on the telephone exchange software of Xelion. I expanded it by:
Connections: 

• To import contact details from third parties with an API (like Salesforce) in our telephone book. This could entail thousands of contacts.
• Reports: To give clients of our telephone exchange software information about their telephone traffic from and to their own company.
• SSL-Encryption: To establish a safe connection with our telephone exchange software.', 'title': 'Java Developer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Tramei / Bijlesnetwerk', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Soest / Nijmegen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Tramei / Bijlesnetwerk', 'description': 'After I finished my university degree, I worked as a math tutor. At the time I wanted to become a mathematics teacher. I really like to convey and explain mathematics to others. I also like the challenge of figuring out what a student does not yet understand to ‘create a bridge’ between known and unknown knowledge. In 2015 I decided to become a programmer, because running a class of 30 teenagers doesn’t suit me.', 'title': 'Tutor Mathematics/Physics/Chemistry', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}]
